modules.description: Processes a structured data type by applying custom operations to its fields, with distinct handlers for red, green, and blue components. Operates on a type `t` that includes mutable fields and indexed elements. Used to transform, inspect, or modify data structures in specialized workflows like color processing or configuration updates.

Applies custom transformations to a type `t` with mutable fields and indexed elements, handling red, green, and blue components separately. Supports operations such as modifying values, extracting properties, or updating configurations. Can adjust color intensities, filter data, or apply conditional changes based on field content. Enables precise control over structured data in specialized processing pipelines.

manages structured color data through targeted modifications to red, green, and blue components, allowing for dynamic adjustments and conditional updates. It defines a type `t` with mutable fields and indexed elements, supporting operations like value alteration, property extraction, and configuration updates. Users can fine-tune color intensities, filter data based on component values, or apply transformations in pipeline workflows. For example, it can normalize color values or isolate specific components for further processing.

Provides functions to generate and format system status reports, including extracting error logs, calculating performance metrics, and serializing results into JSON. Works with custom record types representing system states and error lists. Used to produce diagnostic outputs for monitoring tools and automated alert systems.

Provides operations to modify individual pixels in a graphical buffer, using a color type and integer indices. Works with a structured type representing a canvas or image. Allows direct pixel manipulation for tasks like image editing or rendering effects.

Handles UDP communication to control LED strip colors via Pixel Pusher devices. Accepts color data in RGB format and sends structured packets over network sockets. Used to synchronize lighting effects in interactive installations or real-time visual displays.

manages LED color configurations through mutable structures, enabling precise control over RGB values and conditional updates; provides tools to generate system diagnostics and serialize status data; supports pixel-level image manipulation using indexed color assignments; allows for real-time color adjustments, error tracking, and visual rendering tasks.
